intro: Phyllanthus zygophylloides, commonly known as the golden sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that store water, adapting to its harsh environment. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers, which are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a three-lobed capsule that releases seeds when mature. Phyllanthus zygophylloides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
